description: When the user struggles with waiting, endurance, or rushes outcomes — seeking spiritual strength through patience and trust in divine timing.

primary.text_en: O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
primary.text_ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱسْتَعِينُوا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَٱلصَّلَوٰةِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
primary.explanation: Patience is not passive — it’s spiritual strength.

primary.text_en: O you who have believed, persevere and endure and remain stationed and fear Allah that you may be successful.
primary.text_ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱصْبِرُوا۟ وَصَابِرُوا۟ وَرَابِطُوا۟ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ

primary.text_en: And whoever is patient and forgives — indeed, that is of the matters [worthy] of resolve.
primary.text_ar: وَلَمَن صَبَرَ وَغَفَرَ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَمِنْ عَزْمِ ٱلْأُمُورِ

primary.text_en: And be patient, for indeed, Allah does not allow the reward of those who do good to be lost.
primary.text_ar: وَٱصْبِرْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُضِيعُ أَجْرَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
primary.explanation: No good deed or moment of patience is ever wasted.

primary.text_en: Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience.
primary.text_ar: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ
primary.explanation: Community uplifts through shared patience and truth.

primary.text_en: How wonderful is the affair of the believer! For his affair is all good — if something good happens, he is grateful... if something bad happens, he is patient — and that is good for him.
primary.explanation: Both ease and hardship can grow the believer.

primary.text_en: The strong one is not the one who overcomes others by force, but the one who controls himself while in anger.
primary.explanation: Inner control is a sign of strength.

primary.text_en: When Allah loves a people, He tests them. Whoever is patient has the reward of patience...
primary.explanation: Trials are gifts disguised — patience unlocks the reward.

primary.text_en: No fatigue, nor disease, nor sorrow, nor sadness, nor hurt, nor distress befalls a Muslim — even the prick he receives from a thorn — but that Allah expiates some of his sins for it.
primary.explanation: Even small pains count toward great reward.

duas.text_en: Our Lord, pour upon us patience and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.
duas.text_ar: رَبَّنَآ أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرٗا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَٱنصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
duas.explanation: Ask Allah for divine patience and strength in trials.

duas.text_en: O Allah, I ask You for steadfastness in affairs and determination in righteousness.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الثَّبَاتَ فِي الأَمْرِ وَالْعَزِيمَةَ عَلَى الرُّشْدِ
duas.explanation: A daily dua for focus and inner calm.

reflection: Impatience comes from a heart wanting to control — but Allah teaches surrender. Trust that everything unfolds in divine timing. Even when answers feel delayed, your growth is not. Be like the seed in the soil — buried, still, yet destined to rise beautifully.
